title: Talent Management Advisor Job at NTEL
content:
NTEL, is a Nigerian telecommunications companythat launched as a 4G LTE provider in 2016. It was formed after NATCOM Development and Investment Limited (NatCom) acquired the assets of the defunct NITEL.NTEL aims to redefine the Nigerian telecommunications landscape by offering high-speed internet access and clear voice over LTE. NTEL aims to deliver its services across the largest possible network coverage in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Talent Management Advisor
Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and execute comprehensive talent acquisition strategies to meet current and future hiring needs across all department
	Identity talent needs based on business goals and strategic manage the recruitment process by working closely with HRBPs and hiring managers to ensure the right candidates are identified and selected.
	Identify high-potential talent within the organization and develop strategies for their retention and growth.
	Foster a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion in recruitment and hiring practices, aligning with the company’s values and objectives.
	Develop and implement performance management frameworks that align with the company's business objectives.
	Manage the end-to-end recruitment process, from job posting and sourcing to interviewing, selection, and onboarding.
	Conduct regular employee surveys and feedback sessions to monitor engagement levels and identify workforce challenges.
	Analyze and report on talent acquisition metrics to assess the effectiveness of recruitment strategies and make data-driven improvements.
	Perform additional assignments and responsibilities as requested by line manager/supervisor


Education / Certifcation


	Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Professional Certification in Human Resources (e.g., ACIPM, SHRM-CP, PHRi, or similar) is required


Experience:


	3-5 years of experience in, Talent Acquisition, Recruitment, HR generalist, or a related field, preferably within the Telecommunication environment or related industry.
	Experience with applicant tracking systems (ATS), recruitment automation tools and HR software
	Experience with performance management, learning and development, and workforce planning.
	Experience working with diverse teams in a large, fast paced organization.


Competencies:
Knowledge


	Knowledge of labour laws, HR policies and best practices.
	Knowledge of recruitment and HR operations
	Knowledge of performance management systems and frameworks


Skills:


	Effective communication skills
	Strong multi-tasking and organizational skills
	Sound decision making and initiative
	Good interpersonal and leadership skills
	Strong research and analytical skills.
	Excellent relationship building and stakeholder management skills
	Negotiation skills
	Conflict Resolution skills
	Microsoft Office Suite
	Use of HRIS platforms and Talent Management Software
	Data Management


Behaviour:


	Resilient
	Integrity
	Adaptable
	Empathy
	Attention to Detail
	Proactive and solution-oriented
	Discretion and confidentiality
	Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Self-motivated and able to work unsupervised.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV (PDF) to: careers@ntel.com.ng using the Job Position and Job Location as the subject of the email.

title: Property Officer Job at NTEL
content:
NTEL, is aNigerian telecommunications companythat launched as a 4G LTE provider in 2016. It was formed after NATCOM Development and Investment Limited (NatCom) acquired the assets of the defunct NITEL.NTEL aims to redefine the Nigerian telecommunications landscape by offering high-speed internet access and clear voice over LTE. NTEL aims to deliver its services across the largest possible network coverage in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Property Officer

Job Location: Marina, Lagos Island - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Coordinate and oversee the daily maintenance and repair of properties, including scheduling contractors, supervising work, and ensuring high standards of upkeep. This involves responding promptly to maintenance requests and conducting regular property inspections.
	Act as a primary point of contact for tenants, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and fostering positive relationships to ensure high levels of tenant satisfaction and retention. This includes facilitating move-ins and move-outs and communicating important property information.
	Assist with property-related financial tasks, such as collecting rent, processing invoices, tracking expenses, and preparing basic financial reports for review by the Property Manager
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date property records, including tenant information, maintenance logs, inspection reports, and financial documentation. Prepare regular reports on property status, occupancy, and operational activities.
	Assist with the administration of lease agreements, including tracking lease terms, coordinating renewals, and ensuring tenant adherence to lease obligations and property rules.
	Source, engage, and manage relationships with various service providers and contractors (e.g., cleaners, landscapers, security) to ensure quality services are delivered efficiently and cost-effectively.
	Ensure properties comply with all relevant health, safety, and environmental regulations. This includes conducting safety checks, managing emergency procedures, and ensuring the security of the premises.


Education / Certification


	Higher National Diploma (HND) or Bachelor's Degree in Real Estate Management, Estate Management, Facilities Management, Business Administration, or a closely related field.
	Certifications related to basic property administration, safety, or customer service would be considered a plus.


Experience:


	Minimum of 1 - 3 years of experience in a property administration, property management, or facilities support role.
	Proven track record in assisting with the day-to-day operations and maintenance of properties.
	Experience in tenant interaction, handling inquiries, and resolving minor issues.
	Familiarity with coordinating and overseeing contractor work.


Competencies
Knowledge:


	Basic understanding of property maintenance practices and common building systems.
	Familiarity with health and safety regulations applicable to property operations.
	Knowledge of basic lease terms and tenant obligations.
	Awareness of customer service principles.
	Ability to learn and utilize new software and tools quickly.


Skills
Communication skills:


	Time Management skills
	Ability to prioritize and multitask in a dynamic environment.
	Problem-solving skills
	Attention to details
	Active listening skills
	Fluent in English
	Team Player
	Proficiency in general office software (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel).


Behaviour:


	Committed to providing excellent service to tenants and stakeholders.
	Demonstrates honesty and strong ethical principles.
	Possesses a confident demeanour in interactions and decision-making.
	Works cooperatively and effectively within a team environment.
	Maintains a polite and respectful attitude.
	Ability to handle challenges and setbacks constructively.
	Open to new ideas and able to adjust to changing priorities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV (PDF) to: careers@ntel.com.ng using "Property Officer" as the subject of the email.

content:
NTEL, is a Nigerian telecommunications company that launched as a 4G LTE provider in 2016. It was formed after NATCOM Development and Investment Limited (NatCom) acquired the assets of the defunct NITEL. NTEL aims to redefine the Nigerian telecommunications landscape by offering high-speed internet access and clear voice over LTE. NTEL aims to deliver its services across the largest possible network coverage in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Procurement

Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and implement procurement policies, procedures, and strategies to optimize spending and enhance operational efficiency.
	Identify and mitigate procurement-related risks, including supplier reliability, regulatory compliance, and market fluctuations.
	Establish and manage strong relationships with key suppliers and vendors to ensure the timely and cost-effective delivery of goods and services.
	Develop and oversee procurement budgets and spending forecasts, ensuring cost-effective purchasing decisions
	Ensure that procurement processes comply with internal policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements
	Build, train, and manage a high-performing procurement team, fostering a culture of efficiency and continuous improvement
	Monitor industry trends, pricing fluctuations and emerging best practices to enhance ntel’s procurement strategy.
	Present procurement performance reports and strategic recommendations to senior management.


Requirements
Education / Certification:


	Bachelor's Degree in Supply chain management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Masters in a related field is required
	Relevant certification and/or professional qualification from recognized bodies(CIPS, or similar) is required


Experience:


	7+ years of experience in logistics including:
	3 years in a leadership role, preferably in the Telecoms, ICT, or Finance sector.
	3 years in managing logistics operations, optimizing supply chain efficiency, and driving cost reduction strategies.
	Managing investor relations, working with Senior Executives and Boards of Director


Competencies:
Knowledge:


	Knowledge of supply chain management principles, logistics technologies,and warehousing
	Knowledge of procurement best practices, contract negotiation, and vendor management
	Knowledge of International shipping and import/export regulations (if applicable)


Skills:


	Strategic thinking and decision making
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills,
	Excellent sourcing and negotiation skills
	Risk assessment and mitigation
	Microsoft Office Suite
	ERP and Procurement software.
	Analytical and problem-solving skills
	Computer and Information Technology
	Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment.


Behaviour:


	Resilience
	Adaptable
	High integrity and ethical standards
	Analytical and detail-oriented.
	Commitment to continuous improvement
	Leadership and team development
	Collaboration and relationship building


Method of Application

content:
NTEL is a Nigerian telecommunications company that launched as a 4G LTE provider in 2016. It was formed after NATCOM Development and Investment Limited (NatCom) acquired the assets of the defunct NITEL. NTEL aims to redefine the Nigerian telecommunications landscape by offering high-speed internet access and clear voice over LTE. NTEL aims to deliver its services across the largest possible network coverage in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, Internal Audit

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Examine financial records, accounting practices, and operational procedures to ensure accuracy, compliance, and efficiency
	Identify potential risks to the organization and evaluate the effectiveness of risk management strategies
	Provide constructive feedback and recommendations to management on how to improve internal controls, risk management, and operational efficiency
	Monitor adherence to relevant laws, regulations, and company policies
	Where necessary, investigate potential fraud or irregularities
	Prepare clear and concise audit reports for senior management, outlining findings, recommendations, and progress on implementing corrective action
	Work with other departments and stakeholders to improve processes and address identified issues
	Keep abreast of changes in relevant laws, regulations, and best practices within the audit profession


Education / Professional Certification


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. A master's degree in finance, audit, or an MBA
	Certifications in ICAN or ACCA is mandatory. Other relevant certifications (CPA, CFA, CISA, CIA) are expected.


Experience:


	Extensive Auditing Experience:
	A minimum of 7-10 years of experience in internal audit is required, with at least 3 years in a senior or leadership role.
	Experience in the Financial Services Sector (desirable):
	Risk Management and Regulatory Compliance:
	Experience in conducting risk-based audits and navigating regulatory requirements
	Experience in Leading Audit Teams


Knowledge:


	Proficiency in accounting and auditing principles
	Knowledge of relevant laws and regulations
	Proficiency in the use of audit software and tools.
	Knowledge of Audit Methodologies and Frameworks
	Familiarity with international standards like COSO,SOX,andISO


Skills:


	People management skills
	Team building skills
	High level of integrity, objectivity and proofessionalism
	Management skills
	Strong analytical skills
	Report writing skills
	Problem solving skills
	Excellent communication
	Ability to manage and lead audit teams, delegate tasks, and provide guidance
	Excellent interpersonal skills


Behavioral Competencies:


	Team player
	Passion for Excellence
	Attention to details and accuracy.

title: Radiographer (ECG Proficient) Job at Solution Impact Global Resources
content:
Solution Impaact Global Resources - Our client, a reputable diagnostic and imaging center, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Radiographer (ECG Proficient)

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	This role is ideal for a licensed imaging professional with strong technical expertise in radiographic procedures and hands-on experience in ECG diagnostics.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting high-quality imaging and ECG tests, ensuring patient safety, and supporting clinical teams with accurate diagnostic data.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Perform radiographic imaging procedures, including X-rays
	Conduct and interpret ECG tests
	Ensure proper patient positioning and adherence to radiation safety protocols
	Maintain and calibrate imaging equipment, reporting any faults promptly
	Collaborate with physicians and healthcare professionals to support diagnosis and treatment
	Maintain accurate and confidential patient records
	Uphold infection control and quality assurance standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Radiography or Medical Imaging
	Minimum of 3 years of post-NYSC experience in a clinical or diagnostic setting
	Valid license from the Radiographers Registration Board of Nigeria (RRBN)
	Proficiency in ECG procedures is essential
	Ultrasound imaging skills are an added advantage
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills
	Ability to work independently and within a multidisciplinary team
	Familiarity with digital imaging systems is a plus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: solutionimpactglobalresources@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
